name: Sony A99
description: On its tenth anniversary, the Sony A-mount full-frame DSLR series underwent resuscitation in such a way that the celebrated Sony A99 received a successor. The Sony A99 II has taken over the 42.4MP Ekmor R BSI CMOS sensor from the Sony A7R II (also without a low-pass optical filter), but boasts a new front-end LSI processor (which works in conjunction with BIONZ Ks) that enables this DSLR -in the camera to monitor the speed sensor (burst is 12 fps with AF / AE tracking). The A99 II is Sony's first full-format DSLR to feature the proven 4D Focus system, which features a combination of 79-point AF sensors and a 399-point focus plane with detection phase, resulting in a 79-point hybrid AF system with phase detection (Hybrid Phase Detection AF) (of which 15 cross). Focus works perfectly even in low light, up to -4 EV.
